meanings.definition: The act of removing glamour or charm from something.
meanings.sent1: The deglamorizations of the movie set revealed the reality behind the scenes.
meanings.sent2: The deglamorizations of fame often go unnoticed by the public.
meanings.sent3: The deglamorizations of the princess's life made for a funny story in the tabloids.
meanings.sent4: Her deglamorizations of the fashion industry shocked many aspiring models.
meanings.sent5: The deglamorizations of the old mansion exposed its true worn-out beauty.

meanings.definition: The process of making something seem less attractive or desirable.
meanings.sent1: The deglamorizations of the advertisement made the product look ordinary.
meanings.sent2: The deglamorizations of the resort turned away potential tourists.
meanings.sent3: The deglamorizations of the cake's decoration left it looking plain but tasty.
meanings.sent4: His deglamorizations of the job market painted a bleak picture for recent graduates.
meanings.sent5: The deglamorizations of the party theme made it less appealing to the guests.

meanings.definition: The state of being stripped of glamour or allure.
meanings.sent1: The actress experienced deglamorizations when she took on a gritty role.
meanings.sent2: The deglamorizations of the once luxurious hotel were evident after years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The deglamorizations of the fashion show backstage antics were surprisingly entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The deglamorizations of the celebrity's lifestyle were a wake-up call for many fans.
meanings.sent5: The deglamorizations of the fairy tale ending left the audience in awe.
